newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK consortium seeks loan for Belcher Gardens.
newsitem.headline: HK consortium seeks loan for Belcher Gardens.

text.p: The consortium led by Shun Tak Holdings and Sun Hung Kai Properties (SHKP) has asked banks to submit underwriting bids on a loan financing for the Belcher Gardens redevelopment project, sources said.
They said the size of the facility is HK$6.4 billion and the tenor is expected to be five years.
The loan is expected to finance a signficant portion of the project, which is in Hong Kong's Pokfulam district and occupies some 2.45 million square feet of residential space.
The project is held 51 percent by Shun Tak, 29 percent by SHKP, and 10 percent each by New World Development Co Ltd and Liu Chong Hing Investment Ltd.
Bankers said the consortium has invited banks to submit proposals based on three different structures that depend on the proportion of loan guarantees provided by Shun Tak and SHKP.
In the first proposal, every shareholders will take up a percentage of the guarantee in proportion to their equity stake in the project.

In the second proposal, while New World Development and Liu Chong Hing each will guarantee a percentage of the loan in proportion to their equity interest, Shun Tak and SHKP each will offer 40 percent of the guarantee.
In the third proposal, the guarantee commitments of New World and Liu Chong Hing will be 10 percent each, but Shun Tak will offer 31.67 percent of the guarantee and SHKP 48.33 percent.
"If SHKP provides greater portion of the guarantee, the risk on the financing will become lower and the consortium will save on the borrowing fees," bankers said.
